intro: Lopholaena whyteana, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the island of Christmas Island in the Indian Ocean. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces striking red, bell-shaped flowers that bloom during the wet season, attracting various pollinators. Its unique floral structure and habitat make it an important species for local ecosystems. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, it is also considered a conservation concern.
